forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. Southwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
As the dawn unfolds over Downtown San Francisco, the air is tinged with a coolness that lingers just before the sun makes its gradual ascent. The city is cloaked in a delicate veil of clouds, holding a promise of partly sunny moments to come. Currently, temperatures hover around the low fifties, complemented by a gentle southwest breeze whispering through the surroundings. This soft wind stirs the budding foliage and carries the faintest hint of salt from the bay, suggesting an active marine layer still nestling close to the shoreline.

Throughout the day, expect a modest climb in warmth, reaching into the sixties. Yet, as afternoon draws near, a subtle retreat will usher temperatures back toward the cool embrace of the morning. While the clouds are expected to give way to patches of blue, the potential for lingering fog in the coastal regions may keep some northern vistas shrouded. Dress in layers to navigate the changing scene—perhaps a light sweater with a comfortable jacket for those errand runs. Given the forecast, a peaceful stroll through one of the city’s many vibrant neighborhoods might provide the perfect antidote to any lingering sleepiness, or perhaps a quiet moment seated in a cozy café, where the warm aroma of freshly brewed coffee can ease you into your day.
